controller

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends Object
    The GameController class is for containing the game play logic and performing actions on the game state (GameInstance). This class also has methods to load and save game states - in xml format from/to disc.
    Author:
    Team B

      • game

        private GameInstance game

        private Config gameConfig

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController(GameInstance game)
        Constructor with specifying a GameInstance. Creates a new GameController with a specified GameInstace.
        Parameters:
        game - The GameInstance which will attached to the controller

      • GameController

        public GameController(Config gameConfig)
        Constructor with specifying a configuration. A new game instance will be created with this configuration.
        Parameters:
        gameConfig - The game configuration to use to create the GameInstance.

      • GameController

        public GameController()
        Constructor without specifying a GameInstance. Will create a new GameInstance.

    • Method Detail

      • getGame

        public GameInstance getGame()
        Gets the current GameInstance of the controller.
        Returns:
        The current game instance of the controller.

      • setGame

        public void setGame(GameInstance game)
        Sets the GameInstance specified to the controller.
        Parameters:
        game - The GameInstance that is to be set to the controller.

      • loadGame

        public GameInstance loadGame(String fileName)
        Wrapper method to load a game state (GameInstance) from disc. This method validates the parameters and calls the method loadGameState for the actual load.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file name of the GameInstance saved.
        Returns:
        The loaded game state converted into a GameInstance object.

      • loadAndSetGame

        public void loadAndSetGame(String fileName)

      • loadGameState

        private GameInstance loadGameState(File file)
        Method to load a game state (GameInstance) from disc. Load a valid XML file from disc and converts to a GameInstance object.
        Parameters:
        file - The file name of the XML file where the GameInstance is saved.
        Returns:
        The loaded XML file converted to a GameInstance object.

      • saveGame

        public void saveGame(String fileName)
        Wrapper method to save a game state (GameInstance) to file in XML format. This method validates the parameter and calls the method "saveGameState" to do the actual save.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file name where the state of the game is to be saved to.

      • saveGameState

        private void saveGameState(File file)
        Method to save a game state (GameInstance) to file in XML format.
        Parameters:
        file - The name of the file to save the game state as.

      • drawAndPlaceTile

        public boolean drawAndPlaceTile(int rowOfGameBoard,
                       int colOfGameBoard)
        This method draws a tile from the tile bank and places it on the specified row and coloumn of the game board.
        Parameters:
        rowOfGameBoard - The row index of the game board to place the tile.
        colOfGameBoard - The column index of the game board to place the tile.
        Returns:
        Returns true if draw and place was successful - otherwise returns false.

      • drawTile

        private Tile drawTile()
               throws Exception
        This method draws a tile from the top of the tile bank and returns that tile. This takes care of reducing the no of tiles in the tile bank.
        Returns:
        The tile that has been drawn from the top of the games tile bank.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • placeFirstTile

        public boolean placeFirstTile(int playerIndex,
                     int rowOfGameBoard,
                     int colOfGameBoard)
        This method takes the player's tile (the first tile given to the player at the beginning of the game) and places it on the game board.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The index of the player whose tile is to be taken.
        rowOfGameBoard - The row where the tile is to be placed.
        colOfGameBoard - The column where the tile is to be placed.
        Returns:
        Returns true if placing the first tile was successful - otherwise returns false.

      • hasPlayerFirstTile

        public boolean hasPlayerFirstTile(int playerIndex)
        This method checks if a particular player has the first tile in hand - or is it already placed on the game board.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The index of the player whose tile is to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player has the first tile in hand - otherwise returns false.

      • placeCastle

        public boolean placeCastle(int playerIndex,
                  Castle.CastleRank rankOfCastle,
                  int rowOfGameBoard,
                  int colOfGameBoard)
        This method places a castle on the game board at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The player whose castle is to be placed.
        rankOfCastle - The rank of the castle that is to be placed.
        rowOfGameBoard - The row index of the game board where the castle is to be placed.
        colOfGameBoard - The column index of the game where the castle is to be placed.
        Returns:
        Returns true if placing of the castle was successful - otherwise returns false.

      • isValidPlayerIndex

        private boolean isValidPlayerIndex(int playerIndex)
        Checks if the specified player index is valid for this game.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The player index number that is to be validated.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player index is a valid player index for this game - otherwise returns false.

      • hasPlayerCastlesInHand

        private boolean hasPlayerCastlesInHand(int playerIndex,
                             Castle.CastleRank rankOfCastle)
        Checks if a player has a particular rank of castles in hand (not on the board).
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The player whose castle stock is to be checked.
        rankOfCastle - The rank of the castle that is to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the player specified has the castles of specified rank in hand - otherwise returns false.

      • isGameBoardPlaceValidAndVacant

        public boolean isGameBoardPlaceValidAndVacant(int rowIndex,
                                     int columnIndex)
        Checks if a the specified place on the game board is vacant (a game component such as castle/tile to be placed at that location).
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index of the game board to check.
        columnIndex - The column index of the game board to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified location of the game board is vacant - otherwise returns false.

      • placeComponentOnGameBoard

        private void placeComponentOnGameBoard(GameComponents gc,
                             int row,
                             int col)
        Places any game component (tiles/castles, etc.) on the game board. The objective of having this method is to abstract placing of any game component on the game board. Note that this is private method and should not be accessed by outside classes. This is for use of other methods within this class.
        Parameters:
        gc - The game component to place.
        row - The row index where the game component is to be placed.
        col - The col index where the game component is to be placed.

      • playOneEpoch

        private void playOneEpoch()
        Plays one epoch (executes all the player turns until the game board is used up).

      • playEpoch

        public void playEpoch(int epochNoToPlay)
        Plays the epoch specified.
        Parameters:
        epochNoToPlay - The epoch no to play.

      • playAllEpochs

        public void playAllEpochs()
        Plays all epochs sequentially and ends the game.

      • resetGameAtEpochEnd

        public void resetGameAtEpochEnd()
        Resets the game state to the epoch beginning.

      • setHighestScorerOfEpochToCurrentPlayer

        private void setHighestScorerOfEpochToCurrentPlayer()
        Sets the highest scorer of the current epoch to the next player.

      • displayScores

        private void displayScores()
        Displays the scores of the players after epoch end.

      • incrementEpoch

        private void incrementEpoch()
        Increments the current epoch to the next one.

      • resetCastles

        private void resetCastles()
        Reset the castles on the game board. Returns the rank 1 castles to the player - returns other castles to the game box.

      • resetTiles

        private void resetTiles()
        Reset the tiles on the game board.

      • getPlayerStrategy

        private PlayingStrategy getPlayerStrategy(int playerIndex)
        Gets the player strategy for the player specified.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The player index whose strategy is to be fetched.
        Returns:
        Returns the playing strategy of the player index specified.

      • setPlayerStrategies

        private void setPlayerStrategies()
        Sets the playing strategies for all the players.

      • nextVacantSpaceOnBoard

        protected int[] nextVacantSpaceOnBoard()
        Gets the next vacant space on board.
        Returns:
        Returns the row and column index of the next vacant space on the game board as an int array. The first item of this int array is the row index of the vacant space, the second item is the column index.

      • nextAvailableCastleRank

        protected Castle.CastleRank nextAvailableCastleRank(int playerIndex)
        Returns the rank of next available castles that the player has in hand starting from rank one castles.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - The index of the player whose castle stock is to be looked at.
        Returns:
        Returns the rank of the next available castle stock of the player.

      • calculateScore

        public void calculateScore()
        Calculates the score.

      • updateScoreColumnWise

        private boolean updateScoreColumnWise(int rowIndex,
                            int colIndex,
                            int[][] colScores1,
                            int[][] colScores2,
                            boolean divideCol,
                            boolean goldMineImpact,
                            boolean dragonTileImpact)
        This method updates the column wise score arrays based on the type of tile in the specified location.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index of the location to check.
        colIndex - The column index of the location to check.
        colScores1 - The 1st array to store the column wise scores (for tiles above any mountain tiles).
        colScores2 - The 2nd array to store the column wise scores (for tiles below the mountain tiles).
        divideCol - Determines whether to divide the columns due to the existence of a mountain tile in the column.
        goldMineImpact - Determines whether to include the GoldMine impact (multiply all resource and hazard tile values by 2).
        dragonTileImpact - Determines whether to include the Dragon tile impact (nullify all the resource tiles values).
        Returns:
        Returns whether to keep the column divided due to an existence of a mountain tile in the column.

      • isLocationAdjacentToWizardTile

        private boolean isLocationAdjacentToWizardTile(int rowIndex,
                                     int columnIndex)
        Method to check if a location on the Game Board is orthogonally adjacent to a wizard tile.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index of the location on the Game Board to check.
        columnIndex - The column index of the location on the Game Board to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified location has an orthogonally adjacent wizard tile - returns false otherwise. If the specified location is invalid also returns false.

      • hasLocationWizardTile

        private boolean hasLocationWizardTile(int rowIndex,
                            int columnIndex)
        Method to check if a particular location has a Wizard tile.
        Parameters:
        rowIndex - The row index of the location on the Game Board to check.
        columnIndex - The column index of the location on the Game Board to check.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified location has a wizard tile - returns false otherwise. If the specified location is invalid also returns false.
